channel.title: General Infiltration Discussion
channel.description: Want to talk with the forum regulars, offer the team some constructive criticism, find a reliable server, or just want to praise the team in general...here's the place.

item.title: Checking in...
item.author: invalid@example.com (RaekwoN)
item.dc:creator: RaekwoN
item.content:encoded:
Man oh man, much like all the other guys who've dropped in, I too can't believe this site / forum is still going. Crazy to think that it was almost 10 years ago that I was working on the Iraq and Tuscany maps (and that I remembered my forum details today).

What happened to me? I stopped mapping, dropped out of University and went and worked in advertising for 7 years as a game "producer". Now I'm out of that working for myself and have been making Flash games for a living for nigh on 2...

Checking in...

item.title: OK, get ready...
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
After a couple of weeks of poking around and trying things, I have a bunch of questions I'm going to scattergun all at the same time, but each one is wholly different, so they all merit their own threads (kind of unfortunately, as I'm going to look like the all-time Infiltration idiot). Nonentheless I'll be most grateful for any and all responses, even "hey, you're a total dweeb for wanting to do this", as long as I get an answer!

--A whole lotta TIA

item.title: Inf weapons intro
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
I've been asking lots of questions and getting lots of help here, and feel a bit guilty because I'm not going to be joining any servers anytime soon, being pretty much a confirmed SP guy and also having blown all my future playtime for a couple of months just getting back up to speed with Infiltration (it's complicated if you've been away for over a decade, forgot everything, and are essentially starting from scratch, not just with Inf but UT99 as a whole).

So in token recompense for the...

Inf weapons intro

item.title: botdirector & bothealer in Community Ed 2006?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
In community edition 2006 there are two mutators, botdirector & bothealer, which come without documentation. In the *.int files botdirector says that you can order bots by "pointing to things" but offers no clue how, not even a command to get help in the console. Same with bothealer; it says "bots know first aid" and displays messages that they apparently say, but offers no way to implement any of this. And the bots certainly do not spontanteously give any first aid on their own! I ran a...

botdirector & bothealer in Community Ed 2006?

item.title: Spawner.mut (in Community Ed)?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
Looks like I've finally got myself a stable Inf install that I can use to tackle the UnrealSP campaign with, and do some practice botmatches on the side from time to time to better my skills up. Just a couple of questions. First, what's this Spawner.mut? It came with the Community Edition but with no docs. The *.ini implies that you can configure it to spawn monsters, but I loaded it with no results. Is it maybe just for mappers, so they can more easily put monsters into Inf maps, or...

Spawner.mut (in Community Ed)?

item.title: Music in coop SP
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded: This is actually really important to me. On my trial runs at playing UnrealSP through Inf, sounds are present but no music. I searched for solutions and the only recommendation I found was to make sure you're using Galaxy audio rather than OpenAL. Didn't help. Is there a way to hear the music assigned to SP maps while one plays them via Inf?

item.title: S3TC, Inf, & psytex
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
Weaponpack 1.6.1 requires that S3TC textures be enabled for the video renderer, at least for some purposes (see the SCAR's "Field Manual"). This implies that one should have said textures installed. However, https://forums.beyondunreal.com/threads/getting-the-perfect-inf-install.170880/ explicitly says that the S3TCs should not be used with Infiltration. Is this outdated, or does S3TC eye-candy goodness now play nice with Inf?

A similar question was asked in...

S3TC, Inf, & psytex

item.title: M3S90 texture problem
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded: This is not a big deal, as I can use the M1 and there's virtually no difference, but the M3S90 has a texture bug (or mesh bug--I don't know which): when aiming, the stock is missing and I can see through to my entire trigger hand. I've been installing a lot of things over the past couple of weeks, so have no idea what caused this. Any thoughts?

item.title: Clean-install CE2013 with no console
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
Just clean-installed in order to try to solve various issues. This time tried out Community Edition 2013. And with no modifications, no alterations of any kind, no mucking about with any of the INIs even in the most insignificant add-on mod, I've got no console. (Still working in regular UT).

Of course the first thing I checked was the two user INIs, InfiltrationUser.ini and User.ini. Neither had a binding for the console (tilde was empty in both) so I added it in both. Restarted Inf but...

Clean-install CE2013 with no console

item.title: Bonuspack & Weaponpack 1.6.1 loadouts don't work
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
OK, I'm going to pm gopostal re his offer to make me a custom Monster-Hunt mutator (post https://forums.beyondunreal.com/threads/monster-hunt-in-infiltration.204622/). But it's probably not going to work until I get one problem ironed out: From the very beginning since I installed Weaponpack 1.6.1, I can't get any weapons to load out except the core Inf 2.9 (often called, I gather, "vanilla").

I installed Psycotex at the same time; maybe that has something to do with it?

item.title: Decalstay
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
In the package un_toys_22_11_2004 there's a mutator called UN_DecalStay. I'd dearly like to get it to work--that kind of effect is crucial for Single-Player IMHO, for being able to see where you've been already--but when I do what the readme says and add this line to Infiltration.ini...
[INF_Console.INFc_Console]
RootWindow=K_INF_DecalStay.K_INF_DecalStay_RootWindow
;RootWindow=INF_Menu.INFm_RootWindow
...commenting out the original RootWindow line, Infiltration stops at the splash...

Decalstay

item.title: Summoning Problems
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
All you INF coders have done such a fabulous job that I simply cannot restrict myself to a core set of one-to-one replacements for the Unreal/UT weapons. I have a wider set of various weapons with which I sort of randomly replace the default Unreal implements: with the sole exception of the Automag/Enforcer (which I replace exclusively with the UNhandgunFix Desert Eagle .50AE) and the Biorifle (exclusively replaced by the Benelli M1S90), no UT weapon is restricted to a single Inf arm; for...

Summoning Problems

item.title: WeaponPack 1.61 missing files
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
Prior to taking gopostal up on his very kind offer (https://forums.beyondunreal.com/threads/monster-hunt-in-infiltration.204622/), I need to test WeaponPack 1.61 (https://forums.beyondunreal.com/threads/infmod-weaponpack-1-6-update.193283/). I am especially interested in the M60 (the big boys are just too much fun, especially when you've got hordes of B-movie monsters to mow down!) Unfortunately there are missing files.

According to the 1.61 page, various...

WeaponPack 1.61 missing files

item.title: Difference between coop game vs. coop game (fixed)
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded:
I'm getting ready to play some single-player with Inf weapons--not botmatches but actual single-player maps. There are good instructions re how to do that for Old Unreal, and the game mode you choose (in the Mission screen) is "INF - Coop Unreal Game". However, there are also a lot of single-player maps available (custom, user-made) for Unreal Tournament. Which game mode is best for that? It'll be either "INF - coop game" or ""INF - coop game (fixed)", but which one?

And what's the...

Difference between coop game vs. coop game (fixed)

item.title: Monster Hunt in Infiltration?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Ironword300)
item.dc:creator: Ironword300
item.content:encoded: How do I get a Monster Hunt game going in Inf? I've got Monster Hunt installed but it doesn't show up in the Inf gametype (Mission) dropdown listbox, and I can't find any how-to's online. But I know it's possible because someone posted a youtube video of them playing MH with Inf: <iframe width="500" height="300" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Fx8kJ2Ye-YA?wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe> . Any veterans out there know how to do this? I'd be most grateful for hints.

item.title: Infiltration Source Code is free???
item.author: invalid@example.com (godzzo)
item.dc:creator: godzzo
item.content:encoded: Can I download anywhere? I am interesting in it.

item.title: Any old school INFers still around?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Chronic)
item.dc:creator: Chronic
item.content:encoded:
It's been YEARS! How is everybody?

I'm trying to get back into INF, however I am finding it hard to get UT installed on OSX. I don't even know if it is possible.

So...who's still around?

item.title: INF game
item.author: invalid@example.com (Biene_Maja[FOOL])
item.dc:creator: Biene_Maja[FOOL]
item.content:encoded: We (XploD, Sierra, Icarus, Matiwas and me) played great games today. Tomorrow we want to play again.

item.title: Re-using the INF modes and asset for a new game
item.author: invalid@example.com (comandore)
item.dc:creator: comandore
item.content:encoded:
Hey all

Long (long ....) time since I played INF online. That being said, it still hold a lot of memories for me.
I figured that creating a game with the assets from INF would be lots a fun

However, I have some trouble getting hold of the models and such.
I figured that using the WOTgrealExporter I could export the stuff out of the
.u files. But this feels kinda hacky and im not sure I can get everything (like animations) from this exporter.

Does anyone know if there is a...

Re-using the INF modes and asset for a new game

item.title: Do people still play INF?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Derelan)
item.dc:creator: Derelan
item.content:encoded: Hey folks, I haven't played INF in years. Do people still play online? Whats the average player count on servers?
